alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 2:01PM PST until December 25 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 PM PST MONDAY BELOW 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected below 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch, with ice accumulations of one to two tenths of an inch. Above 4500 feet, snow will transition to rain on Monday, with 2 to 6 inches of snow expected. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Oregon Cascades mainly around Mount Hood. In Washington, South Washington Cascades, mainly from Indian Heaven Wilderness to the Columbia Gorge. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 10 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
